search.query: | inputlookup alert_settings| eval key=_key | append [| rest /services/admin/savedsearch splunk_server=local | search action.script.filename=alert_handler.py disabled=0 | fields title | rename title as search_name] | dedup search_name | eval priority=if(isnull(priority),"unknown",priority) | eval auto_assign_user=if(isnull(auto_assign_user),"unassigned",auto_assign_user) | eval auto_assign=if(isnull(auto_assign),0,auto_assign) | eval auto_ttl_resolve=if(isnull(auto_ttl_resolve),0,auto_ttl_resolve) | eval auto_previous_resolve=if(isnull(auto_previous_resolve),0,auto_previous_resolve) | table key, search_name, priority, auto_assign, auto_assign_user, auto_ttl_resolve, auto_previous_resolve

ul.li: priority: The priority of the incident. Used together with severity to calculate the incident's urgency
auto_assign: If auto_assign is set, automatically assigns the incident to a user and changes the state to "assigned".
auto_assign_user: If auto_assign_user is set, the incident is assigned to this user
auto_ttl_resolve: If auto_ttl_resolve is set, resolves the incident, if the alert's ttl is reached.
auto_previous_resolve: If auto_previous_resolve is set, a previously opened alert will be automatically resolved.
